title: The Index of Forbidden Books
description: A fast breakdown of The Index of Forbidden Books for builders.

hook.text: For 400 years, the Catholic Church maintained a list of books no Catholic was allowed to read.

buildup.text: The Index Librorum Prohibitorum was created in 1559 to combat the spread of Protestant and scientific ideas.

discovery.text: Galileo, Descartes, Voltaire, and Victor Hugo all landed on the list â€” the greatest minds of their eras.

twist.text: Being banned by the Index often boosted book sales â€” publishers secretly celebrated making the list.

climax.text: The Index was finally abolished in 1966, but it had listed over 4,000 titles across four centuries.

punchline.text: The Church's forbidden list became a reading recommendation.
